meanings.definition: Grain that is ground to make flour.
meanings.sent1: The miller used the grist to make fresh flour every day.
meanings.sent2: The farmer brought bags of grist to the mill for processing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to steal some grist from the mill.
meanings.sent4: The grist flowed smoothly through the millstones, turning into fine flour.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly ground grist filled the air in the bakery.

meanings.definition: Something that can be used to one's advantage.
meanings.sent1: Having a strong network of contacts can be valuable grist for your career.
meanings.sent2: She saw the criticism as grist for improvement rather than discouragement.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected challenge turned out to be just the grist she needed to prove herself.
meanings.sent4: Every setback is just grist for the mill of personal growth.
meanings.sent5: Learning from mistakes is essential grist for success in any field.

meanings.sent1: The old windmill was used to grist the wheat into fine powder.
meanings.sent2: She carefully gristed the corn kernels to make cornmeal for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The children took turns gristing the grains in the traditional stone mill.
meanings.sent4: The baker grists the wheat with precision to ensure the quality of the flour.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of gristing echoed through the valley from the watermill.
